definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]

sentences.english: She rushed out of the hut when she heard her dappled cow low in dismay.
sentences.chinese: 听到小花牛惊慌的哞哞低鸣，她快步跑出茅屋。

sentences.english: She rushed out of the hut when she heard her dappled cow low in dismay.
sentences.chinese: 听到小花牛惊慌的哞哞低鸣，她快步跑出茅屋。

sentences.english: And you'll never hear the wolf cry to the blue corn moon.
sentences.chinese: 而且你会再也听不到野狼对米白蓝的月亮哞叫。

sentences.english: Maybe moochel should ride the trains.
In case danger lurks and a cow needs to make any sudden… moos .
sentences.chinese: 万一周围有险情出现，牛会突然哞哞叫起来。

sentences.english: In case danger lurks and a cow needs to make any sudden… moos .
sentences.chinese: 万一周围有险情出现，牛会突然哞哞叫起来。

sentences.english: We love the smell of the earth warming and the sound of cattle lowing.
sentences.chinese: 我们爱闻大地回暖的气息，爱听牛群哞叫。

definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
